east_asian.text: If you owe a dog anything, call him "sir."
The old horse in the stable still yearns to run.
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
Do not talk Arabic in the house of a Moor.
If you wish your merit to be known, acknowledge that of other people.

A person who doesn't know but knows that he doesn't know is a student; teach him. A person who knows but who doesn't know what he knows is asleep; awaken him. But a person who knows and knows that he knows is wise; follow him.
A friend is one who warns you.
The greatest tranquility is when we desire nothing.
Tell me your friends, and I'll tell you who you are.
You cannot think you could teach a fish to swim.
Experience is a comb which nature gives to men when they are bald.
Building a castle is difficult. Defending and maintaining it is harder still.
Better to see something once than to hear about it a thousand times
The jay bird donâ€™t rob his own nest.
